Pengeroyok yang Lempari Ayah-Anak Pakai Batu di Jeneponto Ditangkap
07 Nov 2019, 12:53 by Hermawan Mappiwali
Makassar - Rani (32) ditangkap polisi karena diduga ikut mengeroyok Mantari Dg Nuntung (60) dan Ambo (30), ayah-anak di Jeneponto, Sulsel. Akibat pengeroyokan, Ambo tewas sedangkan Mantari kritis.
"Keterangan dari Rani bahwa dia (ikut) melempar batu juga ke korban," ujar Kasat Reskrim Polres Jeneponto, AKP Boby Rachman, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Pengeroyokan berawal dari peristiwa saat Rani warga Kampung Batu-batua mencari kudanya ke ladang yang bercampur dengan kuda milik Mantari dan Ambosekitar pukul 13.30 Wita, Senin (4/11). Ayah-anak ini menuduh Rani berupaya mencuri salah satu keduanya.
Persoalan ini dibawa ke rumah kepala dusun Batu-batua, Desa Datara, Kecamatan Bontoramba. Tapi sebelum sampai ke rumah kepala dusun, ayah-anak ini diduga melakukan penyerangan ke Rani yang dituduh mencuri kuda.
"Ada luka di tangannya (Rani-karena ditebas)," sebut AKP Boby.
Setiba di rumah kepala dusun, warga setempat--yang juga tetangga kampung Rani--tiba-tiba menganiaya ayah dan anak dengan melempari batu.
"Kami masih lakukan lidik (selidiki) pelaku lain," kata Boby.

The Robber Throwing the Father and Son in Stone in Jeneponto Arrested
Nov 7 2019, 12:53 by Hermawan Mappiwali
Makassar - Rani (32) was arrested by the police for allegedly involved ganging up on Mantari Dg Nuntung (60) and Ambo (30), father-son in Jeneponto, South Sulawesi. As a result of the beatings, Ambo was killed while Mantari was critical.
"Information from Rani that he (participated) also threw stones at the victim," said Kasat Reskrim Jeneponto Regional Police, AKP Boby Rachman, Thursday (11/07/2019).
The beating began with an incident when Rani, a resident of Kampung Batu-batua, was looking for her horse in a field mixed with horses belonging to Mantari and Ambosekitar at 13.30 Wita, Monday (4/11). The father-son accused Rani of trying to steal one of the two.
This issue was brought to the house of the Batu-batua hamlet chief, Datara Village, Bontoramba District. But before reaching the hamlet head's house, the father-son was suspected of attacking Rani who was accused of stealing horses.
"There is a wound on his hand (Rani - because it was cut)," said AKP Boby.
Arriving at the hamlet head's house, local residents - who are also neighbors to Rani village - suddenly abused their father and son by throwing stones.
"We are still investigating (investigating) other perpetrators," Boby said.
